name: Temporal MIDI Quantizer
description: This algorithm is a MIDI quantizer that quantizes the position of notes in time (much like applying quantization to the timing of a MIDI clip in your DAW). Timing can be derived from MIDI clock or from clock pulses on the algorithm’s input bus. It only affects MIDI notes – other MIDI messages are not processed. Because there is no concept of ‘replacing’ or ‘consuming’ MIDI events in the disting NT, you will usually want to use different input and output MIDI channels (e.g., receive MIDI notes from your keyboard on channel 1 and output quantized notes on channel 2).
use_cases: Correcting human timing inaccuracies in live MIDI performance
Aligning MIDI notes to a grid for electronic music production
Synchronizing MIDI events with external clock sources

specifications.name: Channels
specifications.description: The number of MIDI channels to process: 1-16

input_ports.name: Clock input bus
input_ports.description: Input bus to use for clock if Sync is set to Clock.

input_ports.name: MIDI notes (per channel)
input_ports.description: Input MIDI notes on the specified Input channel.

output_ports.name: Quantized MIDI notes
output_ports.description: Output quantized MIDI notes on the specified Output channel.

output_ports.name: Breakout output (if enabled)
output_ports.description: MIDI output to breakout port if 'Output to breakout' is enabled.

output_ports.name: Select Bus output (if enabled)
output_ports.description: MIDI output to Select Bus if 'Output to Select Bus' is enabled.

output_ports.name: USB output (if enabled)
output_ports.description: MIDI output to USB if 'Output to USB' is enabled.
